Replies.Reply: 1    THE ELECTRONIC WORLD                                         1  On one side of the screen, computer programming language is being printed, and we HEAR the sound of an electronic keyboard. In the center of the screen, glowing lines inscribe a rough computer simulation of a figure, in response to the programming. Gradually the figure is completed and refined, as we HEAR a resonant voice speaking.
As astonishing advances in computer science are made, artificial intelligence programs are being designed to assist us in every area of life...

In a world-wide network of electronics, they travel through miles of circuitry at the speed of light. We created them to calculate and research, to help us design and heal and think. With all that they can do, are they only electrical impulses...
You're getting brutal, Sark.
WARRIORS MUST STAY WITHIN THE GAME GRID.
SARK!
Lemme play you again?
Yeah, if you've got another quarter.
Sark, my man! You are hot!
That knuckleball gets 'em every time, boy...
Thank. you, Master Control.
Sure, I'd love to go up against some of these guys ... be a nice break from these accounting creampuffs you keep sending me. Which branch of the service?
Nice.
is being escorted by a guard..
Yes, MCP.
You've got it. I've been hopin' you'd send me somebody with a little moxie ... what kind of program is he?
A User?
Well, I -- it's just -- I don't know, a User, I mean... Users wrote us. A User even wrote you...
But-what if I can't...?
Wait...I need that...
Yes...acknowledge, Master Control...
Greetings. The Master Control Program has chosen you to serve your system on the Came Grid.
Those of you who continue to profess a belief in the Users will receive the standard substandard training.

The Master Control Program regrets that it cannot be responsible for Identity disks lost or stolen. if you lose your disk, or fail to follow commands, you will be subject to immediate de-resolution. That is all.
Wait a minute...put this guy against one of the other recruits.
Finish the game!
Kill him!!!
You'll regret this.
No! You said he could die in the games  211  FLYNN                                                        211  staring up. The image on the mirror wavers and dissolves.
Get them. Send out every Game Tank in the Grid! Get them!
Get the pursuit force back into 404A.
We better, null unit. I'll be lucky if the MCP doesn't blast me into a dead zone.
Make contact with master Control...
he'll be pleased to hear we're all finished with that User he sent us.
That old fruitcake Dumont...
Bring in the logic probe!!
Dumont!
Where's the program?
Take him!!!
Now, sir... We did take care of that User you sent us --
We'll get them, sir... These things take time.
No, bit brain.
Prepare him for inquisition. I need a little relaxation. But first rez up the carrier for pursuit... And one other thing.
Don'tthink anymore. I do the thinkingaround here.
Busy dying, you worn-out excuse for an old program.
That's very funny, Dumont. Maybe I should keep you around, just to make me laugh.
Guards! Bring this antique to the bridge so he can watch his friends be obliterated.
So... we have erased the program that -
You! No!
You died! I saw you!
Well... we can take care of that soon enough.
Take this program to the holding pit.
I'm taking our friend here, and some other religious fanatics, to Master Control... the MCP has expressed an interest in assimilating them --
Go!
I don't know how you survived, slave.
It doesn't matter. Prepare to terminate.
You are very persistent, Tron.
Very clever, Tron. You know you should have joined me.
We would have made a great team.
We might be capturing some military programs soon... that interest you?
Strategic Air Command.
What'd he pull?
Who programmed you?
You're in trouble, pal...big trouble.
Suit yourself ...
Get me Dillinger.
Hello, Ed. Thanks for coming back early.
It's our friend the boy detective.
Yes.  It felt like Flynn.
I would if I could find it. it's stashed somewhere off in the system ...
I'm afraid so. I spotted him this time and kicked him out, but he's getting trickier all the time.
End of line.
Ed, I am so very disappointed in you.
I can't afford to have an independent program monitoring me. Do you have any idea how many outside systems I've gone into?
And I was planning to hit the Pentagon next week...
It shouldn't be any harder than General Motors was. But now...this is what I get for using humans.
I've gotten 2,415 times smarter since then.
The same thing I want with the Kremlin.
You wouldn't want me to dig up Flynn's file and read it up on a VDT at the New York Times, would you?
So do as I tell you. Keep that Tron program out of the system. And get me those Chinese language program I asked for.
You shouldn't have come back, Flynn.
That isn't going to do you any good, Flynn.
Stop, Flynn. You realize I can't allow this.
You're entering a big error, Flynn...
I've got a little challenge for you, Sark --
He's not any kind of program, Sark.
That's right. He pushed me...in the other world. Somebody pushes me, I push back. So I brought him down here ...
Now get this straight, pal -- no one User wrote me. I'm worth a couple million of their man-years! I'm bigger than all those little wimps put together!
You rather take your chances with me?
Then pull yourself together. Get this clown trained. I want him in the Games until he dies playing.
End of line.
I hope you've enjoyed being a command program, Sark. I wonder how you'll like working in a pocket calculator... maybe one of those watches that plays "Happy Birthday" to its User once a year.
Yes, and now you've got two renegade programs running all the hell over the system in a stolen simulation.
I don't have time, Sark. And neither do you. End of line.
I am delighted that so many of you could turn out to give your power over to me...
You're very lucky, all of you. You are participating in the creation of the single most powerful program in the history of the system... of all systems...
A program with a will... with ambition... a superior form of life...
Welcome!
Dumont, I'm so pleased that we've finally come to terms with one another...
It is very good that you...
I am the message. The only message.
SARK!
Program... stop. This is not allowed!
I will not allow this Sark!
SARK!!!
SARK!!!
Look, this is all a mistake. I'm just a compound interest program, I work at a savings and loan. I can't play in these video games...
Sure you can, pal. You're a natural athlete, I ever saw one. Come on...
Great, another religious nut.
Got a pirate program here... says his name's Clu.
Came into the system with a stolen password ... an' we caught him tryin' to raid a high-clearance memory.
Are you kidding? Me? I run out to check an the T-Bill rates, I get out of breath. Hey, really...you're gonna make my User, Mr. Henderson, really mad. He's a full branch manager...
Uh, thanks, but... I don't even know what I'm doing here.
Sure, if I don't have a User, then who wrote me?
Crom.
It's murder out there. You can't even travel around your own microcircuits without permission from that Master Control creep. Hauling me down here to play games...who does he calculate he is?
If only Tron was still around...
You ever see that guy in action?
What's wrong? What did I say?
Oh my User...Tron--they've got you in here?
You think you're gonna wipe me right out, don't you?
Welcome to luxury living.
...artillery for Video Game Sector...
You believe in the Users?
That's what you're doing here. Master Control Program's been snapping up all us programs who believe...if he thinks you're useful, he takes over all your functions so he gets bigger...
I'm Ram. They'll train you for the games, but ... well, I hope you make it okay. Hey, what's going on in the other sectors? I've been stuck in this Grid for 200 microcycles.
New guy...
The Users...you really think they're still there?
You want to watch those force fields...
You'll be having plenty of chances to get hurt, don't worry about that.
You're a..."guest" of the Master Control Program. They're going to make you play video games.
Oh, I was an actuarial program...
How 'bout yourself?
Sure, a little disorientation. That's normal, when they transport you. It'll come back to you. You're doing real well in training. Remarkable, really...
Flynn! Look, Tron, he survived!
He was disoriented in transport, Tron.
What do you think?
Recognizers!
The tower, yes -- Flynn, have you remembered anything else about yourself -- like what sector you're from?
Assist Routine -- well, it sounds like a lovely place.
Alan-One...
You think we can make it there?
it's just what we need.
Do you know what he's talking about?
We're inside a Recognizer...
You are crazy -- stealing a Recognizer --
Come here.
Little more juice's all it needs...
Not for long, friend.
Another free program off line.  What's his User s'posed to do -- ?
They'd better be...I don't want to bust outta this dump an' find nothin' but a lot of cold circuits waitin' for me.
Where did you hear that name?
The name of my User, yeah. But how... ?
That's what my User wants, too...
Do it!

Game Tanks! Come on  257  SHOT FROM ABOVE                                              257  as the three cycles rev up and race off, headed for one of the narrow openings in the cliff face, and plunge into it, disappearing from view.
I can feel it ...
Yes... he's got something to tell me...
We have to.
Oh, that's nice. You always forget how good fresh energy feels, till you get to a pure source...
Have some...you'll need it.
What, just the three of us?
I have to find out what Alan wants...
Tanks...coming back. Let's go.
No good...they might block off the old chip.
This way.
I'm not gonna hurt you.
I'm going to let you go now... don't scream, or I'll be very sorry.
Put your hand behind your back.
Yori... hey...
That's all going to change, Yori...

Don't know yet... I have to get in touch with Alan. He was going to tell me how to   Suddenly Yori looks up, sees something, grabs Tron's hand and pulls him back into a nearby alley. She points up in the air.
Why is everything...like this?
You're beautiful, Yori.
I had to...in the games...
I... have come to communicate with my User.
Well I want to communicate --
Dumont... my User has information that could -- could make this a free system again.
Really. You'd have programs lined up around the block to use this place -- and no MCP looking over your shoulder.
Alan-One. He calls me... may I pass?
Confirmed, Alan-One.
Wait! I can't hear...
Yori! Get down!
Flynn!!
You're alive!
Flynn...
Where's Ram?
This is Flynn... the one who busted me out.
Wrote the...?
But -- if you're a User -- then everything you've done has been part of a plan ...
Then...
Well -- that's how it is for programs, yes, but --
Stranger and stranger...
Remember you wanted to pay a call on the MCP?
We're on our way.
Probably decided not to pursue us, The Sea of Simulation is tricky..
Not with this disk. I'm going to check on the beam connection, Yori.
What is it?
We have to get off this beam!
The beam connection...
Yes.
How about you?
Sark!
I'm also better than you....
I don't think it is good for you, MCP.
Sark's out. Would you like to leave a message?
Dumont!

Replies.Reply: Dumont! Where's Yori? Where's Flynn?
Nice...
Where's Flynn?
Think we can merge into this mem'ry okay, good buddy?
Now, ol' Flynn said to look over in here ...
Uh oh...we got company.
You said it ... one of those Recognizers comes after me, gonna hafta jump clear out of the data stream.
Oh my...the long arm o' the law.
No...I must've gotten in there by mistake, I -

Replies.Reply: Forget it, Mister High 'n' Mighty Master Control ... you're not makin' me talk.
No!

Yesssss. Yes. Yes. Yes.
No, nyet, negatory, not on your tintype, no way.

No...
Right on the money!
Yes, okay, exactement!
No, nuh-uh, never in a million years!
Ix-nay! Noper! Under no conditions -

All right!
No way, not on your life, no siree!!

Replies.Reply: You said it.
Yes!
Yes...
Come on, you scuzzy little data, be in there...
I've got such nice blue paper to print you out on, if you'll just sit still...
Ah, hell...busted again.
It's all in the wrist, friends.
Hey! Good to see you guys! Nothing classes up the place like a cleancut young couple.
Good luck. You can't even think in here.
Come on.
So...how's the world of serious science?
Whew. You never were much for small talk.
She still leave her clothes all over the floor?
Touche, honey. Yeah, I've been doing a little hacking here. Which I've got every reason, as you well know...
Tried to.
Can't quite make the connection with that sucker, though. If I had a direct terminal ...
"Embezzling" is such an ugly word, Mister Bailey...
No, actually I'm trying to get a legal brief together.
You haven't told him?

is one of the brightest young software engineers at ICOM. He's so bright that he starts going in there at night, and sets up a private memory file, and begins writing a program for a video game he is inventing, called...
...Space Paranoids.

Replies.Reply: Yepper. And Vice Squad, and Meltdown...
to starting my own little enterprise.
Oh my. Meanwhile, kids are putting eight million quarters a week in Space Paranoids machines and I'm not seeing one dime.
Because somewhere... in one of those memories ... is the evidence. If I got in far enough, I could reconstruct it.
My password ... Dillinger's instruction to divert the data ...
Boy, I bet I know who's workin' late tonight.
Yeah. Tryin' to find the file and erase it.
Not much chance of that now. The MCP can just slip it into another system as soon as it locates it...
Boy, if we were inside, I know how to forge us a Group 6 access...
Hi, Alan.
My dinner.
Want one?
Move aside. Let the kid have some room.
Swell...I'll log us both on, and you can get your Tron thing running...
Hey hey, it's that big Master Control Program everybody's talking about...
Now, how do you expect to run the universe if you let a few unsolvable problems throw you like that? C'mon, big boy, let's see what...
Games, huh? I'll give you --
Oh, man... this isn't happening. It only thinks it's happening...
Hey! Take it easy! Look, if this is about those parking tickets, I can explain everything...
Who you callin' "program," program?
Hey! Who are you guys?
Look...just so I can tell my friends what this dream was about, okay?
Well, great, that's no sweat -- I play video games better than anybody.
Hey, Ram ... what were you ...
Yeah, yeah -- that's great.
Oh, uh...I don't remember too much...
Looks like we're in the same boat here -
No, I   A buzzer sounds. The game begins. Crom hurls a glowing pellet upwards. It strikes the upper platform, ricochets off, and heads straight for Flynn.
Hey!
Okay!
Here's an easy one...
No!
No!
Out of my way, zero bit.
Tron...?
Alan!
Well, isn't it -- ?
I, uh... I'm a program from a User that... knows Alan...?
Yeah, but I'm remembering all kinds of stuff. Like...my User wants me to go after the MCP   Before they can go on, the BUZZER sounds.
I know...
You guys...follow me.
Watch it!
Oh man...when you're on the other side of the screen...it all looks so easy...
It's all circuits...
Well...my home "sector" was called Paramus ...
It grows on you.
Feel what? You okay?
Hey, what's that?
Replies.Didascalie: (pointing to a corner of the cave)

Replies.Reply: well... when do we pay a call on the ol' Master Control?

You know anybody that's got an army for rent, that's fine...but my, uh, User said to go take that sucker out. An' let's face it, the big ox isn't gonna get any weaker. I feel like hittin' him now, while I'm good an' mad. Some nerve...
Okay, that's first. Maybe he knows what to -
What's that?
How about over there...that empty memory?
You gonna make it?
What's goin' on?
Are you kidding? I think it's stealing us -
You okay? You don't look so good.
Hang on. We'll get you outta here.
Damn! Never fails... minute the warranty runs out...
Hey... !
Never gonna figure out how to work this thing...
Okay -- hold it right there!
What do you mean, "'yes"?
That all you can say?
Oh. Anything else?
only yes and no...
You're a bit.
where's your program? Won't it miss you?
I'm your program?
Another mouth to feed... you don't by any chance know how to drive this crate?
Like so?
Way to go! We're haulin'!
This honey doesn't handle so good in town...
Catch me listening to you again.
Hey. Hi. Hey, everything's okay. Fine.
This town's full o' live ones.
This is where Tron said he was going...
Looks like his kind of place, too...
Sshhh I'm still me. Just a different color. C'mon.
Greetings, program...
Yeah, I... oops!
I'm sorry, Tron... he's...
No big deal. I ought to know my way around that Light Cycles routine...
It's time I levelled with you, Tron.
Guess I took a wrong turn somewhere...
You wish. Man, I haven't had a second to think since I got down here. I mean in here. Out here. Whatever.
Look, you guys know how it is. You just keep doin' what it looks like you're supposed to, even if it seems crazy, and you hope to hell your User knows what's goin' on.
I hate to disappoint you, pal, most-the time, that's how it is for Users, too.
So... Nice ship you got here. What's our next move?
All right. Thank God. Alan stayed awake, at least.
What about our friend - Sark?
Not us, I hope.
Boy the view from up here... you know the territory?
What's wrong with that area?
Lousy utility companies ...
There's another beam!
Did we make it?
Hooray for our side...
Hey... you guys OK?
Aah, I'm fine... little hung over is all...
Elementary physics... a beam of energy can always be diverted...
Not me, boss.
Hey!
Look, the door's almost...
Yori!
I'm gonna need your help. Hey, Bit!
Let's get outta here.
Check out the controls.
We're getting closer.
Wait a minute Yori! YORI!! LOOK!
Let's get some power here.
Any response?
Yori, steer us over the beam, right next to it.
Jump.
Probably.
Shhhhh.
I'm sure Tron wouldn't mind if...
Don't worry.
Hey -- you guys   Before he can say anything more, Alan turns to greet him, holding up a seven-inch computer software FLOPPY DISK in its cardboard sleeve.
I know, I met him.
I mean, I saw it read-up -
And Dillinger's instructions to divert them -- it's all there -
You're telling me...
you have any idea how much I can sue these jokers for?
Are you kidding? You guys'll he running this joint by then...
Hey, you know anybody who wants to get hold of some video games... cheap?
Nah...I decided...I've had enough of video games to last me a good long time. I feel like gettin' into some real life...
Hello?
What's up?
Flynn?
He's still looking for that old file...
Meanwhile, he might find it.
I think we'd better shut off all access till we can find that file.
Cute.
Come on in...
Oh, yes. The algorithms on cloud seeding...great piece of work.
oh, you have Group 7 access, don't you?
We have to close that down, just briefly. Security reasons.  Someone with that access has been tampering.
No, no, I'm sure, but -- you understand.
Mmm. Part of the Master Control Program?
Ah. Sounds good. Well, we should have you running again in a couple of days, I hope.
Oh boy.
I'm sorry -
It's my fault. I programmed you to want so much...
The Pentagon?
Now, wait a minute -- I wrote you.
What do you want with the Pentagon?
If you think -
You wouldn't dare.
Walter, I sympathize, but I have data coming out of the Master Control Program saying there is something screwy --
The MCP is the most efficient way of handling what we do. I can't sit and worry about every little user request that --
Doing our business is what computers are for. Look, Walter, with all respect -- ICOM isn't the business you started in your garage anymore --
We're billing accounts in 30 countries, we've got one of the largest systems in existence...
It can be arranged...
I'm sorry, Walt. So much pressure lately...
REQUEST: access to the TRON program, User code 717 - Bailey.
Huh...
Alan. Alan Bailey.
Well, I don't know...I just tried to run this program I've been working on, and I was denied access all of a sudden. I thought maybe I'd been laid off and nobody told me.
Yeah...?
I hope you don't think it's me.

It's called Tron. It's a security program itself, actually. Monitors all the contacts between our system and other systems... If it finds anything going on that's not scheduled, it shuts it down. I sent you a memo on it.
No, it'll run independently.
Beautiful!
Boy, I sit up there grindin' away all day, and you guys are down here disintegrating things and having fun.
Great. Can it send me to Hawaii?
Frustrating. I had Tron almost ready to run, and Dillinger cut everybody with Group 7 access out of the system.
Ever since he got that Master Control Program set up, system's got more bugs than a bait store.
They'll start to soon enough.
into his checking account, I don't know.
Flynn had access to you, too. I'm not interested in talking about him.
Okay, okay...
You call that getting over it?
What for?
Of what?
For what?
What -- ?
Uh, no ... I mean, not that often -
You did break in.
Are you embezzling?
I don't get it.
You invented Space Paranoids?
Senior exec.
I still don't get why you're trying to break into the system.
Dillinger?
Not if my Tron program was running. That would seal the system off. If your file's in there...
Do I gotta?
Hi, Flynn.
I was wondering where you got that glow of good health.
Uh... got any cinnamon?
I'm certainly not.
There you are... look, before we get cut off again...
I'm going to put some new coding on your-disk, so you can get into the memory core of the Master Control...
Flynn! I made it. I worked out some new codes for Tron, put 'em on a disk, and -- it's running.
Your old files -- ?
Oh, that is beautiful. You've got the goods...
Your friend Dillinger sure won't...
Shouldn't you wait till your lawsuit's settled?
Well, here goes nothing ...
Well, I meant -
Let me make sure we're running   She crosses to a COMPUTER CONSOLE nearby. The console is connected to the laser by a few dozen wires and cables.
Looks good...
How's it going upstairs?
Did you say Group 7 access?
Did he say why?
Flynn had Group 7 access.
Oh, I wish you'd forget about that.
I want to go to his place.
I mean I want both of us to go.
To warn him.
That Dillinger's on to him.
For being on to Dillinger.
Hey, where's Flynn tonight?
We have to talk.
Have you been sneaking into the ICOM system?
Flynn!
You can see why all his friends are fourteen years old.
I'm afraid it's a little late for that.
Don't even say that. You've got to find that file before he does..
Shall we dance?
You better get in back with Flynn.
I don't think I'm cleared for this.
Okay ... Flynn, I'm gonna put you at my terminal, down in the laser lab.
As long as we stay off the top floor, Dillinger'll never know we've been in here...
This laser's my life's work.
Well, just don't forget your old friends when you're rich and famous.
You're getting out of the business?
Hah. Interesting, interesting. You hear what you said? "Here goes nothing."
Whereas actually, what we propose to do is to turn something into nothing and back again. So you might just as well have said, "Here goes something and here comes nothing." Hah?
Let 'er rip...
Perfect.
Hello, Alan.
Not disintegrating, Alan -- digitizing.
Yes...but you have to go roundtrip, and you must purchase your program at least 30 days in advance. Hah!
Well, you have to expect some static.
Yes, won't that be grand -- the computers will start thinking, and people will stop. Lora, I'm going to stay and run some data through. See you tomorrow.
Ed, all I'm saying is - if our own people can't get access to their programs ... you know how frustrating it is, when you're working on a piece of research -
That MCP, you know, that's half the problem right --
User requests are what computers are for.
Oh, I know all that. Sometimes I wish I was back in that garage...
That was uncalled-for.
Thank you, no. I have some work to do...
Look operative, you guys. Command Program Sark will explain the training procedures.
What's wrong with it?
I don't know... on the blink or something... damn.
Outta  my way, rookie.
Sure, sure ... just kiddin'.
We'll have them in no time, sir. Long before the interrupt interface.
Sir, what do you want done with the tower guardian, Dumont?
Docking module prepared to disengage, sir.
TRON!!
Oh, Tron... I knew you'd escape...
This way. Come on.
I can't believe how bad it's gotten around here since the MCP started taking over... all the good functions have shut down... everybody looks so dead...
How?
My quarters.
It's a flat. But wait a micro...
Come here.
You've grown, big program.
Dumont... ?
Yes...what--?
Dumont! The door...
This way...there's a simulation we can use...
Yes...it can take us across the Sea of Simulation... all the way out of the Game Grid...to the MCP.
We're off!
Who is this?
Then I owe you some thanks...
A User -- in our world?
A little ...
Over there, the Mountains of Data...
The MCP blasted it... There are very few domains left with any power at all.
Power surge... the transmission beam's too strong!
I can't. There's no junction due for at least 7 or 8 nanoseconds!
It's too far!
Where's he going?
How did you do that, Flynn?
Almost... I just have to adjust our course at the next junction. I'd better go check the instruments ...
He's dead.
He's a User, Dumont. He came to our world... trying to help us...
Dumont...!
You... you brought me back...?
TRON!!
Flynn, we've got to help him!
It's starting   She looks down at the battle. Her hand reaches over and grips Flynn's tightly.
Why? What are you going to do?
But... won't you be de-rezzed?
It's something Users do.
He's gone. He went into the beam.
...all mathematical functions transferred to...
I have to re-route the insurance information bits... Next cycle we start the war game simulation for the MCP... Did you make that accounts receivable adjustment for Sark...
Yes?
Hmm. A difficult proposition...

You know, not so long ago, you could've come in here and seen programs lined up all the way back to those doors, waiting for communion with their Users. The building fund was doing well too...but now...

...this so-called Master Control Program is going around cutting programs off from their natural creators, grabbing all our believers and making them ride around on little motor scooters and shoot things at each other and Weiner knows what all--
Oh, you want to -- hah. I could get myself de-rezzed just-for letting you in here. They hate this tower.
Hah.
When you've been in the system as long as I have, you hear many promises...
Who is your User, program?
All that is visible must grow beyond itself and extend into the realm of the invisible.
You may pass, my friend.
I have waited for this moment many thousands of cycles. It is time for the new order to begin... The Users are waiting.
Program? I'm sure you're mistaken.
What do you want? I'm busy.
Yes, I'm old.
Old enough to remember the MCP when he was just a chess program. He started small, and he'll end small.
Quietly, Yori...
Tron... ?
And who is this?
If the Users can no longer help us...
No... Tron ... must... destroy MCP... first...
They may be... de-rezzed... on the carrier ... hurry...
He really was a User...
Hut! Hut! hut! Hut! Hut!

We see that this vessel is a simulation of a futuristic spacecraft, designed for travel in the Real world using solar energy, with an enormous metallic sail to catch the rays of sunlight like wind, and move with the speed of light.  The sail is at the bow of the craft, and a long, slender walkway connects it with the deck area, which is made up of several connected flattened box-shapes, giving it the look of a dragonfly. In this world, the Sailer catches data transmission beams instead of sunlight, and is propelled along the information paths to the Central Processing Unit.
